OperatorName: AgVantage FS a division of Growmark
FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_prev_prog_2.FR_OtherType: Applicable building, electrical, and plumbing codes. This facility complies with the Iowa Fertilizer Law.
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Visual, Storage Tank, Valves, Piping  & Hoses, Nurse Tank and Pumps
_prev_prog_2.Description: The plan is to minimize those hazards to human health and to the environmentthat are associated with accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. Employees working at the bulk storage plant make routine observations prior to and during transfer operations of the anhydrous ammonia from the storage vessel(s) to nurse tanks. In so doing, they are able to detect problems before they arise. This routine inspection identifies any portion of the system which may be under stress or about to fail. Repairs can be made before they become problematic. Employees are annually trained to recognize the hazards associated with storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia. In addition to annual training for employees who have been on the job for a number of years, the company conducts training for new hires. This training includes classroom instruction, on-site training at the plant, and follow-up observation to determine their individual comprehemsion and understanding. Finally, the company routinely invites local fire department personnel to visit the site. In the event that the local fire department requests assistance in training its employees on anhydrous ammonia, the company cooperates fully in their endeavors.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Facility accidental release and emergency response policy.

The management and employees of AgVantage FS are committed to the prevention of any

accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is

prepared to work with the Jesup Fire Department, Buchanan County LEPC or other authorities, to

mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. The stationary source and the regulated substances handled.

The primary activity at the facility, which is located at 2326 Benson Shady Grove Ave, Jesup IA. Is the storage

and blending of fertilizers for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed

for direct application as a crop production nutrient. The storage and handling system consists of a

storage tank(s), loading risers, associated plumbing and nurse tanks. Access to the site is restricted

to authorized facility employees, authorized management personnel and authorized contractors.

3. The worst-case release scenario and the alternative release scenario.

This facility has developed a worst-case and alternative-case scenario, however, since this is

security-sensitive information it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as required by EPA

regulations.

4. The accidental release prevention program.

This facility complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule and with all applicable state

codes and regulations. This facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the

Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published by The American National

Standards Institute, Inc. as adopted by state regulation and the standards of the U.S. Occupational

Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous

Ammonia". Compliance with these regulations and on-going training of our employees make up our

accident release prevention program.

5. Five year accident history.

Ther

e have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that:

-have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor

-to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, shelter in place, property

damage, or environmental damage.

6. The emergency response program.

The facility has:

-a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;

-provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know

information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA); In the event of an emergency involving

anhydrous ammonia, it is our policy to notify the Jesup Fire Department and the Buchanan County

LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency. Our emergency action plans have been

coordinated with both fire department and LEPC.

7. Planned changes to improve safety.

Safety improvement is on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess

the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no specific safety recommendations for

implementation at this time.
